definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: Jung stated that the start of the work was very identical to a possession.
sentences.chinese: 容格声称作品的出发点是拥有十分相同的目的。

sentences.english: When you get to the end of your route, turn around and walk in the opposite direction until you get to the starting point.
sentences.chinese: 当你的行程终结，转过身从反方向走回你的出发点。

sentences.english: Canonic types served as a point of departure.
sentences.chinese: 典范类型担任一个出发点。

sentences.english: Therefore, the study of cultural difference is the base of the study of the difference of communicational behaviors.
sentences.chinese: 因此，研究交际行为的差异必须以文化差异为出发点。

sentences.english: Saint -Simon's basic argument is of the necessary relation between property and power.
sentences.chinese: 圣西门的基本出发点是财产与权力的必然联系。

sentences.english: Apart from being a departure point for Yangtze River cruises, Chongqing had little to see.
sentences.chinese: 除了它是扬子江游船的出发点外，重庆没什么可看的。

sentences.english: The piriformis fossa and greater trochanter are viable starting points for antegrade nailing.
sentences.chinese: 在梨状肌窝和大转子是可行的出发点，顺行穿钉治疗。

sentences.english: If you doubt yourself, then indeed you stand on shaky.
sentences.chinese: 如果怀疑自己，你的出发点就不稳固了。

sentences.english: I think this should become the jumping-off point in dealing with ants tribe issues.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这是处理蚁族问题的出发点。

sentences.english: This might be a reasonable starting point.
sentences.chinese: 这或许是一个适合的出发点。

sentences.english: Dr Wang's starting point is the redundancy of the genetic code used by nucleic acids.
sentences.chinese: 他的出发点是核酸遗传密码的冗余性。

sentences.english: The school the starting point and end-result of all work is to the people's harmonious development.
sentences.chinese: 学校一切工作的出发点和归宿就是为了人的和谐发展。

sentences.english: Philosophical idea of "humanism" emphasize that a person is the beginning and the end of philosophy.
sentences.chinese: “人本主义”哲学观强调人是哲学的出发点和归宿点。

sentences.english: The second shift in thinking signalled by Citi's manoeuvres concerns policy.
sentences.chinese: 理念变化的第二点是由花旗从策略出发点政策。

sentences.english: After all, we are doing this for the sake of Singaporeans.
sentences.chinese: 其实，这项政策也是以新加坡人的利益为出发点。

sentences.english: Descartes' thought is the starting point of the life science afterworld.
sentences.chinese: 笛卡儿的思想是其后世生命科学发展的出发点。

definition: place of interest/a place one has one's eye on
to consider/to give serious consideration to sth/consideration
